name: The Holy Hand Grenadier (Rogue 29 / Fighter 6 / Paladin 5)
author: Orion

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
The Holy Hand Grenadier


Re-did this draft:

Rogue 29 halfling slinger (Base Ranged AB 43, Base Melee AB 39, Sneak Attack 16d6)
Fighter 6 for combat feats, weapon specialization/epic weapon specialization (+6 damage)
Paladin 5 for disease/fear immunity, boost to saves, divine damage (+2-8 divine damage / hit), taunt / discipline
No exp penalties

With 5-6 attacks per round with rapid shot (and haste) the added 16d6 sneak + 6dmg +2-8 divine damage seems very strong
Called shot can lower enemy dex/movement. Melee (not ranged) crippling strike sneak attacks can destroy the opponent's strength score. 
Has great all round qualities with the ability to melee in a supportive/tank fashion with 364hp (capped at 604), great saves double buff-able (with +cha and +con/dex/wis), disease/fear immunity, slippery mind, improved evasion, epic dodge etc. And rogue skills with 364 skill points.
I dropped the sneak down from 20d6->16d6 for four great dexterities instead to give it higher AB and faster epic dodge, overall it looks more balanced, harder to kill and still lethal. 

Tried a Rogue 35 / Paladin 4 / SD 1 split with 40 AB, 25d6 sneak, but it was too feat staved and didn't like it as much.
Torias has done a great sneak attacking Rogue 33 / Fighter 6 / SD 1 halfling archer so I didn't explore that split further, one can tweak that concept to ones taste (ie a sling in that build would increase AB from 40-> 41).

Appreciate Empyre65's suggestion on the Fighter 6 Paladin 5 split, which I have incorporated in the build and hunearo's advice on crippling strike.
